text: I would not recommend. The owner told me they had an Apple certified tech. This is untrue. I was told I needed a screen when my issue was they phone would not turn on. A new screen did not fix and was given the phone back unfixed. I sent it back to Apple who said the phone was damaged internally which left the phone beyond repair. My experience with this company is that I would not trust them with an expensive phone. The owner seemed hasty to sell screen and promised a lot. In my experience I found a young man were there that was not that knowledgeable. The owner explained her boyfriend who did most repairs was busy. Buyer beware.

name: Latranza Gordon
text: The service is great n quick. I will definitely do business with them again.

name: Minh N
text: Service was nice, fast and prices were good. The phone looked good after repair. Kristie was very nice.

name: Christopher Walker
text:
1. The place stinks like a dirty ashtray when you walk in.
2. A disheveled employee approached me--he was polite--I'll give him that
3. I asked about a new screen for my iPhone 6S+
4. He said, "Wow, those are so new and hard to get. The screen alone will cost $299.00!"
4a.--The above is NOT true--the screen even at the most expensive offering is $180.
4b.--It is NOT hard to get
4c.--If you go to a true Apple store (i.e. Summit Birmingham)--they will replace your screen while you wait for $149.00. CPR with their prices could literally take your phone to B-ham and have lunch and still earn over $200 per phone (when you include labor). Wouldn't be surprised if that is what they do. The guy that waited on me knew the price at the Apple Store when I mentioned it. That is pure speculation on my part; but, this CPR place is a mess and totally unprofessional.

My advice--take a trip to the Apple Store (get an appointment first) and the folks there will make your phone like new for $149. The money you'll save will more than pay for the trip and you'll have enough left over to enjoy a nice lunch at all the great restaurants at "The Summit."

If you MUST get your phone repaired in Montgomery--I suggest "Total Cell Phone Repair." They charge parts + $55 labor--or $235. That's still expensive; but, at least they are honest on the price of the screen. CPR charges $299 JUST FOR THE SCREEN alone--Absolute "Rip-Off" If there labor charges are the same as most--$55.00/hour--that would be $350.00 price tag!!

name: Sam Caudill
text: I got a price that was equivalent to how much it should have coated to fix my Nexus 6 properly, which ran me $290 (big phone screen and nice glass, and $20 for a warranty to fix it if the screen breaks again which they said they wouldn't do after it broke) Except the problem is that the glass they replaced is not the same kind of glass the phone comes with. The glass broke from stress in my pocket while I was at work standing (I'm a cashier), and the phone continues to crack from just being set down. Honestly they did get it fixed properly but they didn't uphold their promise to make it "good as new". They overcharge for cheap glass so you may as well not fix your screen.

name: Foxx Hound
text:
New management which has a new Professional set up. Excellent customer service. Quality work. I Highly recommend.

Mike Grissom of Capitol Hyundai

name: Tori Jackson
text: Worst experience for the last few weeks.. I was told that I would have my iPhone back within 3 days and I have been dealing with CPR for about 3 to 4 week. Within these 3 to 4 weeks I have been more than 5 times and nothing was ever complete. when I got my phone back. My center button was perminately pressed in. So I called back (this should have never happened anyways) and told the guy what was up and we discussed me coming back on Monday (my ONLY off day) and the shop NEVER OPENED. nor was there even a number to leave a message. As a customer I feel this was disrespectful. Because not once was I called this time or the Times before to be told "I'm sorry your device is not ready or, your part didn't come in" anything to prevent me from driving all the way from where I live which is not in the city of Montgomery. The amount of gas that has gone though my car just traveling back and forth to this place is unspeakable.. Because the site  never opened Monday, I took the phone to another repair place only to be told "the hole for this phone is too small. This isn't the right screen." ... So, I paid over 100 dollars to be given back a phone that isn't properly fixed. how can you give a customer back a phone that isn't properly fixed and that's the whole point of the store. I feel like that is SO shady because I did my part. There is no way this couldn't have been seen. My phone stays on voice control constantly which is SO annoying and half the time I can't even control it. I want my money back.

name: Theresa Taylor
text: Workers are good at what they do. But it really took longer than really expected to fix phone due to being sent sub par part...not their fault. But it was a very expensive fix. But the work has done well.... And have not had any issues so far.

name: Bethany Deairy
text: Christi and her tech team show exemplary service! She does everything she can to help you and has you out in a timely manner.

name: Pre'Knechia Carter-Stokes
text:
One word, unprofessional.
My girlfriend and I went into this place expecting her iPhone 6 Plus to be fixed, it ultimately wasn't. We paid $220 and I also paid a rush fee for the screen to come in next day. It did come in next day but here is where the issue came ...
They "fixed" the screen but once my girlfriend got it to the car, the screen still wasn't working. They said it was a defective screen. OK fine, they order another. They put it on and it still doesn't work. I'm just thinking at this point that they don't know what they are doing. So they refund the rush fee. My girlfriend paid CASH to them for these repairs. She requests a refund and they only give her $130 one day and they said come back. Why ? We paid you cash the first time, why would we come back. She agrees and then we come back almost 3 days later asking for the remainder of the refund. He slings open the register and says, "I only have $50 you can either take this or come back." He said it like we were inconviencing him when we gave them three days to get cash. He offers to put the rest on the card, and this was Monday. It's now Thursday and no sign of the refund in sight. Don't go here. Please go to a certified Apple Specialist.

name: De'Shun Thrasher
text: Would rate them lower if I could. Got my cracked iPhone X screen repaired and it glitched the next day. They agreed that it was a fault in the screen but never ordered a replacement. Only lied and had me coming up there about 3 times a week. Also very quick to ignore phone calls once they see you have a problem that they're trying to dodge.

name: nerilis santiago
text: I went to your store on May 11, ordered the part, paid 50% and I was told that the was supposed to come in the next week. I went back a couple of weeks  later to told that the part was not in but in a couple of days they would have the part will be in and nothing. I called on June 6th and I was told that they were going to talk to the owner about it and call me back. He did called me back and told that the part is coming in the next day. That was on June 6. I was finally able to coming on June 17th just to find out that the still didn't have the part. I contacted the owner and she proceeded to text me, so I took it as her way for me to contact her. I send her a message trying to find a solution to this situation and the owner calls me back, tells me she didn't read my message and begins to yell at me and telling me all her  personal things. I tried to sympathize with her and she continued been rude and belligerent. She never gave me the opportunity to explained myself. She asked if I wanted the cellphone repair or my money back. I told her that I wanted my money back and she hang up. I contacted the store and told them my decision just for them call 20 minutes later and telling that they ordered the part. How am I supposed to still doing business with them when the owner, as she identified herself, treated a costumer in that way.

name: Comoletha Jamison
text: The owner Christie is a life saver, we had 4 devices down all in less than 3 days, and her and her crew fixed them ALL in less than 24 hours. Thanks love and look out for my family, friends, etc.

name: Marina Z
text: Great customer service. Very fast. Decent prices. Highly reccomend.

name: Tobi Wasden
text: Love It Everyone is nice and took great care of me and my phone. I recommend everyone who asks me if i know of a place to get my phone fixed i send them to CPR montgomery

name: Christi Russell
text: The best place in town! Their technicians are certified and friendly. Can have your device repaired in less than and hour if the part is in stock or by the next day if they have to order it.

name: John Eidsmoe
text: Courteous, knowledgeable, fixed my phone in a few short minutes.  Recommend highly!

name: Kwanesia Wright
text: Hit my phone on a chair at work and the screen goes out then black, blue, purple, green, and white. Screen is fudged...called and spoke with a representative and said I’ll be in on my lunch break. Long story short phone is working again

name: Amy Kim
text: the staff is very nice and it was ready quickly and the price was nice too

name: akersfam
text:
This business is awful and a rip off!!! Take your repair money to the Apple store or reputable shop! Overpriced, shoddy work by novices, super low quality repair parts, and their “warranty” claims are a total scam- YOU WILL pay twice to fix the unrepaired original problem!  We spent $130 on an iPad cracked screen repair.  When we received it back we had 3 new issues: off-center digitizer, inoperative digitizer and inoperative home key. Despite big talk about warranty, manager/owner Kristy blew us off on 5 separate attempts to allow them another repair opportunity, even with us having to pay again!

We paid another $100 to a reputable/professional repair shop, and repair was done flawlessly for less money. The new guy saved the home key to show us how jacked up the repair was,  and proved that the “damaged lcd” they contended was total BS (it works and looks beautiful now, and we did not replace the lcd!)

This IS NOT a reputable repair place. DO NOT trust them with anything other than a $10 phone screen protector replacement, and make them do the repair in your presence.

If this is the only scathing review here, feel free to disregard. But if this isn’t the only very poor review, then heed the warning and don’t go here. This outfit will be out of business within the year, all due to Kristy and her philosophy of ripping off and gouging hard working customers like you, and very likely worsening or ruining your expensive phone or tablet.

JM Akers

name: Donald Chavis (Bubba)
text:
Do not go between 3:30 and 5 pm. High traffic, low staff.
If Christi contacts you about purchasing your phone or equipment, make sure she knows exactly what you have. I drove there to sell my iPhone 5, after 40 mins of her testing my phone she realized it was not a 5s, my ad clearly stated my phone was a 5. I'm sorry does not replace your time or effort.
They do seem technically knowledgeable, but have not grasped the customer service aspect of the business yet.

name: Jennifer Pope
text: Fast and friendly service! I highly recommend.

name: Eden Thornton
text: Droid Moto Z Play needed new screen.  Went to pick up three different times.  Each time, there was a section of the screen that was not adhered properly.  Each time received a different excuse.  They finally fixed it and delivered it to my office on a Friday.  BTW, they put my SIM card in someone else's phone.  I had to spend an hour at Verizon having a new SIM card programmed.  Sorry Gold I-Phone 7 user, whose phone they placed my SIM card in.  It's my understanding that when we got the reprogrammed one, our old one, in your phone, quit working.  Hope you enjoyed your CPR experience as much as I did.  I gave it back to my child on Sunday evening.  He sat in the den and played on it.  By Monday evening the screen went blue / purple.  By Tuesday morning, it was solid black.  The phone is in an Otterbox with a screen protector and he literally did not leave the chair with it.  Now I am out $220 and have a phone that still does not work.

name: Melinda Laymon
text: Service was the best i have received in a long time and the technicians  were sure of what theyre doing .

name: Jonathan Law
text:
Absolutely horrible, shockingly bad experience. I have never in my life dealt with such an unprofessional group of people. Before I brought my phone to these people, every single thing on it worked perfectly. The only issue I had is that there was a scratch on the left side of the screen that irritated me. So I tried to do the right thing and support a local business (or at least a business in the area). On August 5, 2015, I prepaid $161.49 for a screen and service for an iPhone 6. I was told that I would be notified when the parts arrived.

Days go by, and I don't hear from them. I had to call on the 11th and finally ask what exactly was going on. They had an excuse about how their delivery of parts was delayed. Either way, they'd have it the next day. So I'm pretty understanding, and I agree that'd be fine. I take the phone in on August 12. Again, they do not call me - I had to turn up and see whether it was done. I wait approximately 10 minutes after arriving since they were apparently still working on it. Everything looked good initially when I got it back, but I started noticing problems almost right away on the phone.

There was an absolutely immense battery drain on the phone, but more importantly than even that was the ambient light sensor not working, the backlighting at the top of the phone was WAY off, (and they should have noticed that if nothing else if they repair phones for a living) and the proximity sensor wasn't working. If you don't know what a proximity sensor is, when you hold a smartphone up to your head to talk, it shuts the screen off so it doesn't register contact with the screen. It makes it very difficult to use your phone as a phone when it isn't working. The next day, on August 13, I call them back and explain the issue. They agree to take a look at it again and see if there's something they missed. I understand that sometimes, these things happen.

Can't make it there before close on August 14, but I do arrive on August 15th. Another employee looks at the phone, and says that there's just an issue with the screen at this point. They'll have to order another screen to resolve these issues. It's frustrating, but I understand, and I agree, and ask them to contact me when it is in. I waited 10 days, and heard nothing from them. Called a little late in the day on August 25th, and I was told that they got the part in either the day before or that day. So, I mean, thanks for the heads up, right? Can't make it there that day, so I take it in on August 26th.

On August 26th, I drop the phone off yet again around 12:00. The employee says they're a little backed up, but they should hopefully have it ready in about 2 1/2 hours. I told him it was fine. Close to that time later, I got a call saying the screen was on the phone, and they were going to test the other functions. Got another call later, and they told me that the screen was working fine, but that they could not get the proximity sensor to work. They claimed to have tested different parts, but they simply could not get the proximity sensor to work on the phone. I asked how we intended to resolve this issue, especially since it worked when I brought it to them.

I was told that they could either place a damaged screen on the phone (not my original screen in this case, but one that was much, much more damaged) and get a refund, or that basically, I'd have to live with it. This is literally three weeks to this point, and I absolutely need that telephone. Time I don't have it almost always translates to lost productivity. So essentially, my choice was to get my phone back in worse shape than I brought it in, and get my money back, or to keep the screen and they don't fix an issue they caused. I essentially had no real choice in the matter. I am contacting my credit card company to get my money back. They are a terrible business, and your money would be better spent anywhere else. They should be ashamed, but they're not.

name: Beau Murphey
text:
I bought a golf cart from Infinity about a month ago. My goal was to take it to Florida and have it street legal. Although I knew I should buy from another dealer and probably in a Florida, the owner, Blake, assured me that he would make it legal and promised on at least 3 occasions that if it didn’t pass inspection that he would take the cart back and refund all of my money. I knew I should have gone with my gut, but instead I tried to help the little guy out and go with the small business owner.

I rented a trailer and drove two hours from Atlanta to pick up the cart. Although we had agreed Exactly what would be put on the cart, when I showed up only about half of the items were on the cart. I should have left then, but I had already put down a $1000 deposit for the work. An argument ensued with Blake and when he got there his workers started to put items on the golf cart. However, even though he told me he had them, all of the necessary items were not even in his possession. Many of the nuts and bolts had rust on them. It’s obvious that he just piece meals things together. If you are spending $50 it’s one thing, but when you are spending $5000 things should be right.  However , because I drove all that way  I elected to take the cart anyway and purchase the necessary missing items.

When the final purchase was made, Blake also guranteed the golf cart would run for one year. Well, two weeks after purchasing the cart it started to have trouble. After not passing inspection in Florida, I called Blake and he somehow claimed amnesia about offfering to take the golf cart back- just as I had predicted. So, now I have a golf cart that doesn’t run and I have to take to a reputable dealer to have it repaired.

So, if you are consider purchasing a cart from Infinity Golf Carts, go over every inch of the cart before you accept and pay for it. Blale is Not a man of his word, so make sure that Everything is in writing. Even then, if you have a problem do not expect him to be a man of his word.

text: Came out in a timely manner, saved me from having to get a tow truck when they have tow trucks. Topped them off and told me I had a yoke seal leak and a drive axle leak. Didn’t charge me for the oil he put in my truck. Cut down the price so I could get everything fixed bcuz he didn’t want me having problems down on the road. Sent pictures of all the malfunctioning parts and sent pictures of the new parts once installed. Called and texted the next day to make sure everything was going fine. Charged me less than what I would’ve got charged anywhere else knowingly bcuz my money was funny due to me just paying  to get my motor rebuilt by another mechanic. Told me the other problems I needed to get done in the future. name: Susan Brown
text: T.G. Roofing installed my metal roof when I built my house 13 years ago. SInce then I have had multiple leaks and cannot get them to return my phone calls or come out and look at it. I have hired another company after trying to get several roofers to come out because no one wants to touch someone else's work. FInally I got a highly rated company to come out and they took pictures and showed me where the metal was cut short in several places and patched, most all of the screws are halfway or more out, the edges are patched together causing leaks and overall the work after seeing pictures is very poor. What is really sad is that the original company is not willing to look or stand by their work. so after spending the money and putting a metal roof I now am going to have to replace the whole thing not to mention the wood in several places from the leak. They put screws in the flat part of the metal instead of in the ridges which means water is constantly running over them and slowly leaking into my house. I could understand the metal needing to be rescrewed but because they did not screw it on properly the first time in order for it to be correctly done it will have to be replaced. This company has been around a long time which is one of the reasons we chose to use them in the first place but apparently they have so much business they no longer care about the quality of their work. So sad that  a company would take advantage of people and their hard earned money. I would not recommend them to anyone.

name: Brian Boackle
text: When it came time to get my house painted, I did my research and found Altract to be highly rated so I gave them a shot.  What a COMPLETE DISAPPOINTMENT!  Bryant Darby came for the initial consultation and was very thorough and detail oriented, so I could only assume the painters would follow suit. Long story short, the painters were absolutely terrible! The crew dripped paint EVERYWHERE.  Inside and outside of my house were covered in drips of white paint.  **UPDATE:  The paint drips were on a brand new deck (less than 2 years old); a new rug (less than 2 years old) and newly installed flowerbeds/rocks less than a month before the paint job.  THIS WAS NOT FROM A PREVIOUS PAINT JOB!!!!   Every time they returned to fix something, they'd leave their mark on something else.  It finally got to the point that I didn't even want them on my property any longer.  The lame attempt they made to clean up after themselves was laughable and I was ready to cut my losses** The house wasn't prepped correctly and I have fresh paint peeling already!   They broke bulbs on my string lights and not only didn't tell me, but didn't bother to clean it up!   This crew was completely lazy and careless.  I'm glad others had a pleasurable experiences with Altract, but I would award zero stars if google would allow.

resp.text: Brian, I'm sorry you were unhappy with your painting experience.  The painters did come back to the house to clean off any drips and as we discussed with you onsite many of the drips were from the previous times the house was painted and could not be cleaned.  To my knowledge any drips or spills we were responsible for were cleaned from the house.  If you do have peeling paint from the current job we did for you please remember you have a 3 year warranty that covers any peeling, flaking, or fading. Likely this is not a product of incorrect prep but the conditions in which the paint was applied.  If any moisture gets trapped between the paint and the wood it will peel no matter how well the house was prepped.  This is why we offer the warranty we do.  Please feel free to contact us to schedule any necessary warranty work.  We are happy to fix anything we are responsible for.

name: Claire Green

name: Jackie “Jax” Waller
text:
Stopped here when my boyfriend's phone died and wouldn't start up while we were traveling.  This has happened b4 and a quick charge always did the trick.

I should of went in with him... instead I chose to take the dog for a walk. 15 minutes later he comes out with a new exact same phone and a $71 unnecessary charge!

Cell King tested the phone and found it to be fried due to water damage.  They sold him a new phone for $39 and then made him pay $25 to set it up...

I asked him why did he need me to do it then, lol. I asked him what made them think the phone was fried? He couldn't answer me...

Anyway to make a long story short. I took the new battery and put it in the old phone and it started right up! All it needed was a new battery!

And then to top it up they charged him $25 to put his old sim card in the new phone!

BUYER BEWARE!!

And he handed me the new phone asking me to set it up for him.

name: RACHAEL
text:
I was supposed to have my refrigerator fixed today “ 03/23/2021.. My ice maker and water dispenser does not work... The 1st time the gentleman showed up on time to verify the temperature, model and what needed to be fixed and ordered.  I was okay with that the date was a week ago.  I called Service Care today because at this time I had not received confirmation to verify the time he was coming... There was no confirmation like email, text or no one had called to confirm.  I call the company today and Ms Chen states the parts “may” be in on the 25th of March and I explained to her that this was not explained to me she states the technician does not know when the items comes in I explained to her I don’t know his job of what information should or should not have been relayed to me I just know the date I was told the parts would be in and the date he will be back to fix it.
Of course, I requested to speak to the manager and of course the “MANAGER” is not here but I will relay the message!!!!

Please do not give a date you will fix appliances  if it can’t be done.....

IN THE FUTURE AT LEAST CALL THE CUSTOMER TO LET THEM KNOW THERE IS A DELAY OF DELIVERY OF ITEMS NEEDED SO THE CUSTOMER DOES NOT HAVE TO WAIT!!!!! STILL WAITING, NOT PLEASED AT ALL ... UNSATISFIED CUSTOMER!!!!!

I would not give this one star!!!!!

UPDATE ***03/26/2021**

I’m changing this from “1” STAR TO “4” STARS
The technician and a manager came to my home and apologized for the miscommunication... The part unfortunately would not fix my refrigerator “Ice maker and Water dispenser” because there is a shortage in the wiring and now I need a new refrigerator.  The technician was very professional, detailed in his explanation of why it did not work.  I will use SERVICE CARE again because even thou there was a “ball” dropped in the beginning they did follow up immediately and did not blame everyone else they took OWNERSHIP and that is what we are missing in these days and time....You made a uphappy customer a HAPPY CUSTOMER...

Thank you

resp.text: (Part not available from manufacturer, last one found in the counry, part arrived today, scheduled for today). I apologize, the part required to fix your water dispenser is no longer available from the manufacturer, however we have diligently pursued finding this part through other sources and found the last one available online. I'm sorry about the lack of communication regarding the difficulty of finding this part. We really expected this brand to support their products better with parts availibility. Tracking number 1Z3V582E0318781474 shows that your part was received at 11:42am, and we have confirmed the part is here and good, and our tech will be coming to you in 30 minutes or less!

name: Taliesha Cash
text: I really tried to give this company the benefit of the doubt but after the 4th visit to my house and no resolve  I'm done ..out of $350 and nothing works  my ice maker quit and it was working fine before they started trying to work on my freezer leak ..the freezer is still not closing after the drawer rod and hinges were replaced so that the door would close. it was closing fine and freezing before they touched it...At this point I count it all a lost and I guess I need a new refrigerator sure wish I could have used that $350 on a new one instead of wasting it on all these wasted visits to my house..save your coins and don't call them...

resp.text:
In order to make up for a bad experience, we have offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

This review was written before we refunded this customer. Sometimes a unit is too old, and has too many problems, to justify repair. We issued a refund after the customer decided to buy a new unit rather than approve further repairs. -- Initially we traced her leak to a clogged condensate drain, but she continued to have the leak. After the drain was found clogged again and cleared, it continued to leak. Further investigation found that that her drawer was not closing perfectly because of a defective gear, which was allowing moist room air into the freezer which was building up high levels of frost, which was also causing her drain to clog. When the unit defrosted, it would produce the leak called us about in the first visit. The rails to the drawer were also rusty, which interfered with proper drawer closure. In addition, she had a stuck light switch, which was unrelated to the leak problem.

This company completely WASTED my time yet received payment for a repair that they obviously can not make.  Feels like a scam to me.  Obviously won't do business with Service Care or recommend them to anyone for any reason.

In order to make up for a bad experience, we have offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

name: T N
text: I cannot recommend the Service Care team enough. They thoroughly earned their 5 Stars and exceeded every expectation of top notch customer service one could have. Toxey and his team did everything possible to help me find the part I needed, got it to me in a timely manner, and did so at an extremely fair cost. They put up with my 10k questions and let me pick their brain constantly on symptoms and what it might mean rather than selling me a bunch of parts that may or may not work. If you're looking for a team that will help you with your electronics and do so until the job is done, I would recommend you give them a call first. Thank you for all of your help.

resp.text:
Update: I look forward to hearing from you. Ask for Toxey at 205-956-3777. Thank you!

Wow! I’m so sorry, our hours have been changed for years, and I don’t know why the website wasn’t updated. If you’ll contact me Monday at 956-3777 I would like to hear about your experience and give you a credit towards your service for your wasted gas and time. My name is Toxey McDavid, and I am the owner. - update, I found a part sales page with Saturday hours listed. I’ve contacted our web developer and asked them to hunt these down and fix them. I hope that you’ll contact me and allow me to make this up to you. - Toxey

name: Lee Sharp
text: After waiting a week and a half for the repairman to come fix our LG refrigerator cooling issue, he came, claimed that our compressor needed replacing, and left. A week later, he came back to replace the compressor and fix the icemaker. He did and said it would cool in 24 hours. It did, so we put our food back in the refrigerator. THE NEXT MORNING, it was out again. All of our food was ruined. We had to call the actual LG repairman (which there is only ONE in the city of Birmingham). When he came, he had to AGAIN replace the compressor because the job before was so poor. He also had to replace another evaporator line because it was not working. The icemaker STILL does not work. This is STILL one of the worst experiences. After a month and a half, we finally have a cooling refrigerator, but still no icemaker.

resp.text: Lee, I'm the owner of Service Care and I apologize for your service experience. LG has more than one authorized service company, and I can assure you that we are one of them. I'm just unhappy that you're unhappy, and I would love to hear from you about your experience and do what I can to make it right for you. My company phone number is 205-956-3777, my name is Toxey McDavid, and I truly want to try to make this right.

We were extremely impressed with the efficiency and courtesy of Katie from the administration point.  And we were ESPECIALLY impressed with the professionalism and courtesy of technician Scott Burns.  We will, in the future, call Service Care direct for issues with our major appliances.

resp.text: This review does not make any sense. -- We were paid by her extended warranty to provide service, and her extended warranty would not just abandon her to have to buy a new unit. This customer called to tell us it still had an issue after our repair (no mention of supposed damages at this time), we told her we would be happy to fix it, but she would have to call her extended warranty to send another dispatch. We never heard from them. -- Now we receive a review that implies we ruined her refrigerator and now has to buy a new one? -- This isn't how extended warranties work. We're very confused by this review, as we in no way damaged her refrigerator. We installed two parts, an icemaker and a damper... there's no way we could have damaged her unit, and no way her extended warranty would have told her she had to pay for a new unit (that's not how extended warranties work).

We consider this a repair, as the unit was not functioning before we arrived, and after we spent time working on your issue the dryer was working again. I would love to discuss this with you further, please feel free to call our office at 956-3777 and ask for Toxey. I am very interested in hearing from you about what we could do to make this 5 star service. Thank you!

name: Scott Blanchard
text: When our Bosch in-wall microwave went on the blink, I contracted service care to do a fault diagnosis so that I could order the faulty part(s) and repair it. The technician misdiagnosed the problem as a blown fuse. Once I purchased a new fuse and replaced it (an extremely easy process), upon turning on the microwave the fuse immediately blew again. So, I was out my $85 diagnostic fee and still did not know the real issue. My first attempts to get Service Care to complete the diagnosis were unsuccessful, however, after some time, the service care owner called me and we reached a satisfactory agreement. For this reason, I would use Service Care again and can recommend them to others.

resp.text: Thank you Scott for your feedback about this experience, and for allowing us the chance to make it right. We appreciate you, and look forward to helping you in the future.

name: Ron Berry
text: Was professional and on time.  The tech knew exactly what to troubleshoot based on description of the problem.  I will use again.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ron! We're glad you were satisfied with your service.

name: Your name Your name
text: My LG refrigerator compressor went out. This is one of the companies LG forces you to use. Even with LG covering the expense of the compressor, about 350.00 the quote was 800.00 for then to spend 2-3 hours to repair.  The worst part was the tech told me it was a 50/50 chance it would last. The reason behind the ridiculous price, the tech explained that there was a strong possibility that multiple service calls would be made in the first year and they dont get paid for those, meaning the price hike was to help cover their possible future expense  The going rate from several other companies not affiliated with LG was approximately 400.00 to swap out the compressor, vacume to 5 microns and refill with r134.  Today, I am having another company come to my home and swapping the compressor to the non linear compressor, all paid out of my pocket, the entire job cost me 595.00. So how can it possibly be so much for the LG compressor swap if LG is covering the cost due to warranty? Another noteworthy mentioning is that I told the tech I would mount the compressor myself and would sweat on the copper connections myself, but that wouldn't change the price according to the tech. It's called price gouging and its pathetic. Be very cautious when dealing with this company, there are much better options out there, thankfully I found one, thanks Appliance Service LLC. A small locally owned business with an awesome response time (next day) and an affordable price. He also guarantees his work for a year, same as this one. No, I was not asked to mention his business, but who could resist when these other money bandits are out there preying on the unsuspecting.

resp.text: I appreciate you taking time to talk with me over the phone today about your issues. Your feedback is appreciated and helps us improve the customer experience. I understand where you are coming from, but we are an authorized warranty service provider for LG and we are not allowed to replace any part with a non-standard, experimental part. LG has an extensive process that they require in these repairs, in order to make the replacement compressors they provide function correctly in their units. These requirements add to the ordinary time it takes to repair these refrigerators, that may not be required when using parts that were not made for this unit. Unfortunately, as a warranty provider, our contract prohibits us from using non-standard parts to repair your refrigerator. If you will send us a proof of repair from the other servicer, including the parts used to repair the unit, I would appreciate it. I offered to refund your diagnostic, but did not realize that we did not collect it since we were unable to provide you with the service you desired.

name: Shaunda Kidd
text: Mr. Morgan was on time, and did a great job. Really appreciated his professionalism.

resp.text: Thank you! We're very proud of him, and glad to have him as part of Service Care's family. Happy to service Center Point and take care of your Whirlpool refrigerator.

name: KEVIN FOSHEE
text: Last summer when I had my dryer serviced I thought it was a little expensive, but they did a good job. Well it broke again... But to my disbelief, they honored the 1 year warranty and had the dryer fixed same day at no cost!

resp.text: Thank you! We offer a one year warranty on the services performed to show that we really, really, really stand behind our repairs. And we do! I'm glad we could take care of your Samsung Dryer and hope you don't have any more problems with it.

name: Bucky Wood
text: Very efficient and timely. Expert repair. I will use Service Care and Shay again!

name: Mark Rupright
text:
The power circuit of our five-year old LCD TV blew out and I called Service Care. Barry Beasley came out the next day and verified that it was the power circuit, found a capacitor that had blown, replaced it on the spot, and determined that the damage was more extensive. When he looked up the price of the replacement part, we decided it was more convenient to buy a new TV. He didn't even charge us for the attempt to fix the problem, only the service call!

Barry was very friendly, helpful, and professional. I plan to call on Service Care for other repairs in the future.

name: Catherine Cowden
text: I've known this family for years. My father was a technician with them years ago. Not only was it a wonderful place for him to work and support his family, when it came time for our family to be customers of this company, we were treated like members of their family.

resp.text: The Cowdens will always, always be family. Your dad is a lot of fun, has a good heart, and is one of the coolest guys I've ever known. It's a pleasure providing you with service.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, I'm glad that our service met (and hopefully exceeded) your expectations. It was our pleasure to help you with your washing machine repair!

name: Cindy Cuellar
text: I contacted Service Care in morning and they told me that one of their technicians would be contacting me soon.  The technician, Scott, contacted me 30 minutes later to let me know that he was on his way. Scott and another technician arrived and they were very pleasant and assured me that they would get to the root of the problem with my dryer not heating. Scott checked the fuses, heating element, thermal cutoff, etc. on my dryer and all were working. He determined that the dryer was not heating because the control board on the dryer needed to be replaced. He also recommended that I purchase a new dryer because my dryer was old and it would be much more expensive to replace the control  board and install it. I suspected this might be the end result, but I felt it was best to have the experts make that determination. Despite the fact that I have to purchase another dryer, I was very pleased with the promptness, knowledge and professionalism of Scott and the other technician that came with him, and because of this experience, I will be contacting Service Care in the future if I ever need service on my appliances or television sets. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: We're very proud of the care our technicians show when they come to your home. Scott and Greg are two genuinely good people, that live up to the "Care" in our company name. Proud to have them represent us!

name: teresa spencer
text: Cliff was very friendly and knowledgeable about his job. He’s the best.

resp.text: We're very proud to have Cliff serving all the neighborhoods in 35217, and so glad we could take care of your refrigerator the same day!

name: Patricia Noffsinger
text:
Requested a dryer repair from this service and was very pleased with the overall professionalism and customer service. When the technician came to evaluate my abnormally noisy dryer I was quoted and shown an invoice for parts/labor totaling over $560. I reluctantly chose to have my dryer repaired because buying a new dryer would cost several hundred more dollars. I was also required to pay half of the service fee before Service Care would come out to complete the repair—I assumed so that the very expensive parts could be ordered. When *my technician arrived I was surprised to see him carrying a very small bag of parts and was finished with the repair in less than 30 mins—I was expecting a little bit more for a repair costing well over $500 dollars. Come to find out when I researched the actual cost of parts I found out the parts cost around $35 which means service care charged me nearly 1000k an hr for labor. Please do not use this company. A total scam. Buy the parts yourself, watch a  tutorial YouTube video, and save yourself literally HUNDREDS of dollars.

Heard back from customer service. Per their customer service rep my technician mistakenly charged me for the parts 4 times resulting in a quote that was over $200 dollars more than what it should have been. The invoice I received from the tech clearly states that only one was ordered for a parts/installation fee of $560.11 which alerted my spider sense. Customer service offered me an ultimatum of either $200+ refund because of tech’s alleged mistake (meaning I still paid over $300 dollars to replace a $35 dollar part that took 30 mins to replace) or they would come out to take out the $35 part for a full refund. Despite having been charged a fee of $80+ for an in-home quote which by their own admission was inaccurate they refused to refund that. I only agreed to the repair because based on the description of what needed to be done to repair the unit seemed extensive and beyond my skill set. If I didn’t have to take another day off wrk (on top of the 2 I already had to for the quote and the repair) for them to come out to take back what they put in I would have gladly had them come out and take it out. Found a step by step tutorial video on YouTube and the repair is actually quite simple.

Service Care this type of business practice is shameful to charge such ridiculous amounts of money for simple repairs. This is flat out fraudulent and predatory. Their excuse for such high pricing basically boils down to “We use nationally recognized software to provide quotes...” Translation: We do it because we CAN. Not because it’s RIGHT. They knowingly charge SEVERAL hundred dollars an hr for labor for relatively simple repairs. Buyer beware and be sure to do your research first. This repair could have been easily DIY and done for $35 bucks in parts and a Phillips head screwdriver.

The owner himself discourages buying parts off Amazon in his response but the Service Care website  actually contains a link that customers can use to buy “cheap” OEM replacement parts...from Amazon. :l
Again, a total scam, folks. Stay clear of this place.  Had I not questioned my order I would have been duped.  This is supposed to be a repair that the company does “hundreds” of times but no one from company realized I was over charged by several hundred dollars (not a few dollars but several HUNDRED dollars) until I said something about it. Had I went to Publix to buy a gallon of milk and it rang up for $50, the cashier would have instantly thought, “Huh...it’s usually $3.99. Something must be wrong.” Not Service Care. They will take your money and run without thinking twice about it. They still refuse to refund my in-home quote fee for a quote that was inaccurate.

*Technician’s name removed from review at the request of the owner

resp.text: Hi, I'm sorry you were so unhappy with your experience, and I can see why. The technician made a technical error while building your quote. Instead of quoting for a pack of 4 rollers, he quoted for four 4-packs of rollers. The pricing software that we use thought we were replacing those parts 4 times, which increased the quote. (We would be happy to send you a copy of the original quote, which included the 4 rollers, not one). I feel certain that we would have caught that during our billing process, but we appreciate you calling us so soon after your repair to let us know. We're issuing you a refund for the difference. We stand behind our repairs with a one-year warranty which requires us to use OEM manufacturer parts which are usually more expensive than the cheap ones you find on Amazon. Of course, most of the cost of any repair, from any company, is the labor and skill that it takes to diagnose the problem correctly and replace it in a timely manner. I appreciate the feedback! Good and bad helps us to continuously grow and improve as a company. Listening to our customers has been a huge reason we have been a family and locally owned business for well over 30 years.

name: Anthony Marino
text: Ask questions about ladder work but still charge for service call

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that you were not completely satisfied with your service. However, we base all of our prices off the Major Appliance Service National Price Guide. By using this guide, we ensure that our customers are getting the best possible repair price for their dollar, considering all the factors that go into providing excellent service.

text: They were not able to fix the problem I was having with my stove due to the parts being discontinued, which was fine by itself. resp.text: *Parts no longer available* -- Thank you for the feedback. I can understand your disappointment that the parts that were no longer available for your repair. I spoke with our technician, and he did not mean to "unfix" your burners. When he demonstrated to your husband that they were working, he tells me he honestly thought that they were functioning properly. I'm glad you are able to use the four remaining burners, and I'm terribly sorry that the parts were not available.

name: Kim Brittle
text: Disappointing experience.  I called for a washer and dishwasher repair.  They could not get a technician out for over a week.  I called another local service who could have someone out the next day.  Once I knew the repair needed (motor replacement), I called them back to ask an approximate price if they indeed diagnosed the same repair when they came.  Russ, who answered the phone, was rude and dismissive.  When I asked my question he said "I don't even work on them so I have no idea on that" rather than trying to refer me to someone who would?  After his response I said well I guess I need to cancel the service call I requested and after asking my number said "yep - you're cancelled".  He did not try to earn my business and made it clear he had plenty of customers and no time for one that dared to ask a question.  Unfortunate, but not someone I would trust with a $400-500 repair, if they are unwilling to answer my question or even try to earn my business.

resp.text: Hi Kim, It's our policy to not provide estimates over the phone, whether it's based on the diagnosis of another company or not. I really feel that our customer service representative could have done a much, much better job communicating with you and helping you to understand why we don't do this, and I apologize for the experience you had.

name: Tuan Anh Le
text: Mr  toxey reached out to me and we both had a detailed conversation. I am very appreciative that he did that and for that ive become a loyal customer.....very very good customer service....

resp.text: Hi, I'm Toxey McDavid and I'm the owner of Service Care. Please call me at 205-956-3777 so that we can discuss your repair experience. I looked into your repair and checked on the pricing. Our technician charged almost $30 dollars less than the price quoted in our blue-book pricing guide. (This is the guide used by 1000s of appliance repair technicians to price repairs). I also could not find that part for $9 on Amazon. This is a full heater assembly replacement part that includes the heater element, heater housing, and two replacement thermostats and can not be found on Amazon that cheaply. We never use "knock off" discounted parts, only original manufacturer replacement parts. Most of repair costs are actually for labor and diagnosis, and the total time of that process was a good deal more than 15 minutes by our records. I hope to hear from you soon, I want you to be happy with Service Care. Thank you!

text:
Wish I could give less than 1 star.  I was told the repairman would be here between 8 and 12, I called at 12:15 to ask about the status of the tech.  I was told that he would not be coming because I never returned a confirmation call.

When I questioned them about the confirmation call I was told they called on three separate occasions.  I had no messages on my machine and no missed calls from their number.  When I told them that fact, they became argumentative about the calls rather than finding a way to resolve the issue.

I would run as fast and as far away from this company as possible.  If you are using this company because you called Lowe's customer service then I would ask the customer rep for another service company.  If you called this company because you found them on the internet then hang up the phone vector they answer.

We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

name: Eric Smith
text:
I had a 65" Plasma TV which all HDMI inputs stopped working. I called and I spoke to Russ. I asked for someone to come out to look. After I told them my location I was told it would be $85 to inspect, but if they did repairs it would be subtracted from the labor cost. My TV was expensive so I was willing to accept the risk that it wouldn't be fixed.  and I gave him the model number. The technician called and we arranged a time and he was there in a reasonable amount of time. He asked what the problem was and I explained again that all HDMI ports were not working. He then went to search for a mainboard replacement for the TV. He couldn't find one.

I'm giving them three stars because there was sufficient information given to them to be able to tell me over the phone that they wouldn't be able to find a replacement part. I explained my frustration to the technician. He said that they mostly deal with appliances and he'd never been unable to replace a main board for a somewhat new Panasonic (< 5 years) and that he wouldn't have time to train the staff to get all pertinent information. To me, that's a training issue.

Polite and responsive people, but they need to do better with the information that they are given. They had the part number and the description of the problem. I could have sent them a picture of the back of the TV since that's all the technician needed to see.

resp.text: *We will apply the diagnostic you paid to a future repair* --- I'm sorry that a TV this new is not being supported by the manufacturer. We were as surprised as you were that these basic parts were not available. We will do our best to screen these in the future. I will happily apply the diagnostic fee you paid to a future service call.

name: Pamela Gasink
text: We had 2 appliances with issues: a 7 month old GE Profile telescoping downdraft vent (not raising and lowering smoothly) and a Kitchenaid Architect Series dishwasher (leaking water).  The technician, Craig Harris, was professional, personable and most importantly knowledgeable.  After inspecting the downdraft and learning how new it was, he got on the phone with the GE Customer Care Team and they took over the resolution since the product was covered under warranty (in a previous call that I made to GE... they blew me off with the reply that the unit must not have been installed properly... which it was).  That situation was resolved with a swap of the defective GE downdraft.  Craig then diagnosed the DW problem as a broken soap dispenser that was surprisingly allowing the high pressure water to get into a small hole and leak down through the front panel and out to the corners and then onto my floor.  A 2nd visit was required to allow time for the part to be ordered (expensive little plastic booger).  I was very pleased that the very same person was sent for the installation, this rarely seems to happen with most companies. He was very careful not to scratch any outside components or my hardwood kitchen floors.  He was a quick with his work and above all, an expert.

name: thegary clark
text: had an email conformation on a service date, took 1/2 day off to cover the 12-5 service window. No one showed up so I called and was told I had changed the service date. Who the hell does that?

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

Hi, I'm sorry you had this experience. The first service call for the dryer was submitted via our online portal on August 18th at 10pm for a Frigidaire dryer, and scheduled for August 23rd. -- First thing Monday morning, we left a message for the customer to call us to verify the address (and so we could explain what will happen during service visit). -- 10 minutes later, we received a call back and were told that there was another dryer, a Samsung, and would also like that one to be serviced at the same time. A ticket was created at that time, and both were scheduled for the 24th. (Probably because it was now two calls, not just one). -- The initial email confirming the service call would have been sent Friday after the one unit was scheduled online, which is I think the source of the confusion. I'm not sure why the system did not send a followup email with the new information, and I apologize deeply for that. -- We wouldn't claim that the customer called and changed the service date unless we had received a call from someone, and we certainly wouldn't have created a new ticket for this customer unless we had communicated with someone. That just wouldn't make sense for us to do that. -- We're terribly sorry that the experience was confusing, and that you spent time waiting for a call that never came. We take great care to meet and exceed customer expectations, and we will examine our processes in detail to see what could be improved so that this does not happen again.

We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

If a call was scheduled Friday night for Saturday morning after our technician's paperwork was printed out, it's possible that this could happen. If we had a telephone number wrong, it's possible also that we would not make it out to your home. But I am just guessing without knowing more about you.

I would love to hear from you via our email address ( service@servicecare.net ) with information about this, so that I can make sure this doesn't happen again. This is not  how we treat our customers.

Thank you,

Toxey McDavid
Service Care, Inc.

What kind of manager doesn't know how to do her job and do it well. I refuse to walk in this store for business and will take my devices else where as long as she's working and if the Tech guy isn't there. She seems very withdrawn from her work, an lacks motivation skills! Also very hard to take someone serious working on my devices with a big piece of metal sticking out of their lip.

Now as for the ACTUAL TECHS, I've had nothing but great customer service, devices done an ready when they are said to be ready. And always courteous and professional. Very helpful when it comes to explaining what's wrong with the devices. For someone who has done several reviews for several stores on their performances and what they can do to fix it to welcome more business, The manager needs to get some Professional act right, this is a Booming business all over the country not many people can handle this kind of work and all it takes is ONE person to make it to be a bad place of business.

resp.text:
Hello Kayla I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Kayla. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.

name: Travis Porter
text:
Took my iPhone 6 Plus to have the screen replaced due to a very small crack. The associate working said no problem would take about 20 minutes. After 1 1/2 hours later the associate informs me he thinks he shorted out my back light and that my phone would have to be sent off for repair. I am somewhat of an understanding person until he informed me it would take weeks for me to get my phone back. I am a professional in my field of work and 100% rely on my phone to make a living. I was told sorry and that sending it off was the only option for me.. PLEASE BEWARE & DO YOUR HOMEWORK BEFORE GOING TO THESE GUYS FOR WORK. Guess I should have done my homework and read the reviews on facebook first.

Please see above and notice I said nothing about a payment! Today is now Thursday and I am still without a phone! I will also be sure to leave my review with them as well seeing my bad customer service experience has extended to your location as well as your corporate office.

name: Duncan Mills
text:
I’m calling you out IFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (NOT the Dothan Walmart Location). In particular, the manager at this location.

I work for a phone carrier in the same mall and I had a customer approach my stand, asking if the “Apple Airpods” you just sold her were really a legit Apple product. From a few feet away, they looked legit, but upon further inspection, they were definitely a counterfeit. I sell plenty of Apple products out of my store on a daily basis and have for 5+ years. I can tell just by the fit/finish, packaging, font, etc that these are definitely not a real Apple product, or even a refurbished unit.

From what your customer told me, you reassured her that they were a legitimate product, and refused to offer her a refund, only store credit until she threatened to get mall management and the police involved.

Shame on you for preying on elderly and unknowing customers trying to get Christmas gifts for their families. She told me she spent the last $90 of her fixed income to get these for her daughter as a late Christmas gift.

You are selling items under false pretenses and not disclosing the authenticity of the products. Makes me wonder how many other people you have ripped off with this same scam. This is some shady business practices and unfortunately it can tarnish the customer’s trust in cellular/mobile vendors and repair companies alike.

Pictured is the “Apple AirPods” you sold her and the last picture is a stock image of the legitimate product from Google from a trusted device review source.

name: Ryan Cunningham (rjcfilms)
text: Had a broken tablet took it to I fix in the mall and they said they would order the part and it would be a same day repair when it came in. A week or so passed and they called and said the part was in. I took my tablet in for repair they said they may not get to it that day because they were busy... understandable. Well I came back late the next day and they said they still haven't got to it and they would leave a note to do it first thing the next day. Well the next afternoon I called and they still didn't have it ready. So a few more days passed and they called and said they had broken the screen and had to order a whole new screen. Told us we had to wait for the tech to get paid because he had to pay for the new replacement parts. It took more than 1 month to get the new parts and for them to finally call us and say it's ready. We get to the store and ask to pick up the tablet and it is in horrible condition the back panel wasn't even put back on properly and had spots where it was raised up enough I could see the internals on the tablet. We refused to take it that time because it was not repaired. We also learned the the money we origanally paid them to fix it was refunded to the tech who had broken the tablet. The employee/tech refused to try to repair the tablet saying "I'm not going to try to press that together and break that tablet." She was referring the the back panel I mentioned was raised up in places. We told her to contact the manager and she pulled out her cell phone called the manager and said "These people are refusing to take the tablet and I'm so mad I'm about to just walk out" the manager told her to tell us she would take a look at it tomorrow. A few days passed they called again and said it was ready so we went to get it and it was better condition but still it is very scuffed up on the trim all the way around the screen and the back is still slightly raised up in a few places. We took it anyway out of pure frustration with the employees and the manager. This place is a joke DO NOT take anything here to be fixed or you will regret it. This is the first time I've ever written a review but this place was so bad I felt like I needed to put it out there that this place is not a professional establishment and they treat their customers like garbage after you hand them your money.

resp.text:
Hello Ryan  I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Ryan. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations.
Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.

name: Stephen Smith
text: I would strongly recommend against allowing anyone at this location to attempt to repair your property.  I took in my iphone 5s for a cracked screen.  Up front they were very confident stating that it would only take about 45 mins and for a somewhat reasonable price.  The first screen they put on they said was "glitchy".  The second screen had screws that were so over-tightened they pushed through to the glass.  The third screen worked but somewhere along the way several other items were damaged.  When first checking in the phone they did a thorough checklist noting that everything worked properly.  Now I have a phone that doesn't have a vibrate function anymore, the earpiece only works sometimes, and it drops calls all of a sudden now.  They told me that they aren't sure what is wrong and they will order a part and maybe that will work.  I told them I didn't want anyone else trying to work on my phone anymore (3 different people already messed up different parts of the phone).  I asked for a refund and was told that if they got approval from the district manager, they might be able to install a broken screen  on my phone and give me my money back.  Do yourself a favor and read the reviews on Yelp, and the BBB.  This business has shown that they will damage your property and keep your money.

resp.text:
Hello Stephen I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Stephen. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.

They told me that they aren't sure what is wrong and they will order a part and maybe that will work.  I told them I didn't want anyone else trying to work on my phone anymore (3 different people already messed up different parts of the phone).  I asked for a refund and was told that if they got approval from the district manager, they might be able to install a broken screen  on my phone and give me my money back.  Do yourself a favor and read the reviews on Yelp, and the BBB.  This business has shown that they will damage your property and keep your money.

text:
***EDIT***

***Ms. Casey had everything fixed for me once this post was made, 4 starring it for everything that happened. Would recommend to friends, and will go back if I ever need quality work.***

They charged me $120+tax to repair my broken screen and BREAK MY HOME SCREEN BUTTON! Two days ago I took my iPod 5 in to get the screen replaced on it. The home button still worked on it prior to me dropping it off. Once I got my iPod Touch back with the screen repaired my home button no longer worked. Casey, the owner, claimed it to be a result of the damage that occurred to it prior and I had come to found out that it actually was a result of her improperly removing the button. She tore the conductive ribbon strip from the home button that lets it depress and click the dome switch underneath. She claimed that it was not her fault did not offer any kind of apology and told me it was unfixable. I have also been told this kind of repair is not fixable by any conventional means and that the iPod might as well be replaced. DO NOT GET YOUR DEVICES "REPAIRED" AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT. Extremely dissatisfied with this business and it's practice -Eric Faulx

name: Donna Mott
text:
I would not recommend this store to dust off the screen of a phone or tablet much less attempt to repair it.  If I could give less than 1 star, I would.  We took an iPad 3 to iFix on December 20th to have a broken screen replaced.  We called later that evening and went to pick it up after they said it was complete.  We tested the iPad while at the store in front of Tyler, an iFix employee, and the power button wouldn't work, the magnetic closure to put the iPad to sleep wouldn't work, and you couldn't lock/unlock the iPad.  They also scratched the body of the iPad around the edges when they replaced the screen.  Tyler made a note of the issues and agreed we could bring the iPad back for repair after the Christmas holiday.  While we had it, the screen detached from the iPad body.

We took it back to iFix on or about January 9th.  We had to swipe (erase all content) off the iPad for them to repair it, so we had to buy a new one to replace this one in the interim.  We have received NO communication from anyone with iFix since that time unless we've called for a status.  We have called numerous times to speak with the manager, David and Tyler the original employee dealing with us on this.  Each time it's the same story...they're working on it and since that time, David is no longer with them.  I emailed all of the contacts on the Corporate iFix website and never received a response.  The employee we were dealing with, Tyler, can't tell us anything and he said the district manager was now handling our case.

Amber Wells, the District Manager with iFix, and they would not agree to refund the $196.19 we paid for the screen replacement and she said they can't repair it.  I filed a Better Business Bureau complaint in March and iFix never responded to it.  The leasing manager, Rhonda Clark, at Wiregrass Commons Mall has attempted to get this resolved with the owner but has not been successful.  Apparently there are other customers who have complained to the mall management because iFix won't stand behind their work, lack of work, or whatever you wish to call their shoddy attempt at service.

At the very minimum, they should have refunded what I paid for the repair.  Unfortunately now, I have no confidence that the iPad will ever work the same even if someone else replaces the screen.  PLEASE don't make the mistake of taking any devices to this store.

As of September 24, 2014 they STILL have my iPad.  Nearly 9 months later and nothing from them...no attempt at resolution at all.  iFixandrepair has yet to contact me.  Apparently they have no interest in resolving the issue.  I'm taking them to small claims court to try to get this resolved.  Again, I would NOT recommend them for repairs of any sort based on my personal experience and the lack of concern of their staff.

resp.text:
Hello Donna I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Donna. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.

name: Mary Ellen Waters
text: Brandon showed up on time, was courteous and thorough. Wonderful customer service and value. He was able to fix my door and gave us tips to prolong it's life!! We thought we may have to purchase a new door but he helped us put that off for a few more years. I highly recommend this family business!

name: Robert colclough
text: Great costumer service. On time. Polite. Courteous. Fixed problem quickly. Did not try to charge for repairs I didn’t need. Highly recommend that you use these folks!!

resp.text: We thank you.

name: Vivian Strong
text: My father had a very good experience with this company today.  Brandon was very knowledgeable and helpful with installation and insured my father had a good understanding of the workmanship of the door.  Ms. Pammy  in the office was very pleasant and helpful as well.  Definitely would recommend using this company for your garage door needs.

name: Dwanda Schwarz
text: I called Garage Door Rescue when our garage doors aged and broke. The Garage door tech came and was very pleasant and helpful. I paid $95 for him to come and measure my garage door space. He then asked me to check a website and order doors. First the hand written webpage was difficult to find as it had an error when written out. Then when I went to the website all my choices were in black and white drawings. I had no idea how this was supposed to look on my house and called the main office. First I received a voicemail and left a message which was never returned, I called a second time basically pleading for help, the woman who called me back sounded aggravated I had interrupted her and had no desire in helping me. I told her that we are a small business as well and we would like to support another family run small business and I would like to pay her and support her company, yet she still did not change her demeanor. Needless to say they came out in November, no help has been provided to ensure we get the doors we want and here we are in January and we still have no doors and none are ordered, and so far all I paid for is someone to measure my doors, and frankly I could have done that for free. I gave them 4 stars though that isnt my honest rating as it is much less, only because I have no desire in hurting their business by a bad review. If you can order garage doors and know what you are getting from a black and white hand sketching then maybe your experience will be better than mine, however, you have to be fully responsible for knowing you are making the right order with little help from my experience. With so many garage door companies online, I could have done the equivalent,  ordered random doors online for a fraction of the cost myself without paying someone nearly $100 to measure my doors for me. I sure wish the office lady would have helped with the order, otherwise what did I hire them for? to measure my doors? really?????

name: Jan McElroy
text: Great service. Very professional. I will definitely use their services again!

name: Barbara Rudolph
text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Family owned and operated. Same day service. Fast, friendly, efficient, neat & extremely knowledgeable. Repaired what was needed w/ no sales pitches. Went over & above - replaced missing screws, repaired a loose seal & performed routine maintenance at no additional charge! OUTSTANDING!

name: zoltan varga
text: Sometimes when you make a call for services needed, one becomes apprehensive. You search and search then read reviews to hear what people have written to make a sound decision. Well In my case I called garage door rescue based on their 5 star reviews, not one negative comment. Since I needed my garage door repaired. I knew my anti lock springs were broke so I took a chance on calling them first for an appointment. Brandon aka. Skinny guy arrived this morning. I was at work so my wife had to handle the situation. She kept me in the loop play by play and was so impressed with Brandon beyond words! His professionalism, kind demeanor and knowledge was more than she expected. He repaired my issue, and replaced my door sensors I had on hand, reset the motor settings, oiled the chains. I cannot thank him enough for a Job well done. This place has my business from here on out!

name: Philip Hegji
text: I called Monday evening, and they were able to schedule me for the next morning.  They were on time, professional, and reasonably priced.

name: Chris Elliott
text: Prompt and courteous service. True attention to detail. Above and beyond what was expected. Local business at its best.

name: Shana Bass
text: Wow! Unfortunately, the spring on my garage door broke rendering the door totally inoperable, even to lift manually. What a nightmare for a household with 4 vehicles. I anticipated that I would have to call and make a repair appointment for a time days away and then be trapped at home with that dreaded “window” of time, crossing my fingers that someone would eventually show up to fix it during which time our family would have to do the “car shuffle morning, noon and night. I found recommendations on our neighborhood website for Garage Door Reacue. I called at 8:54am to schedule an appointment and was shocked when the ever so pleasant woman said she could have someone out within the hour. At 9:07, Brandon rang my doorbell with ladder in hand and tools at the ready. He explained exactly what he was going to do and gave me an estimate, which I found to be very reasonable, and within 1 hour I not only had a fully functioning garage door but he had corrected some previous installation issues and did the oiling maintenance on the entire track and door. He was efficient, pleasant and personable. As he pulled out of my driveway having completed the repair at 10:19, I was compelled to write this review (something I don’t normally do) to give praise to a great local company with fantastic customer service for a reasonable price. Thanks GDR for a great experience!

name: Brad Hicks
text:
These guys were fast, professional, and knew what they were doing. So glad I called them.

UPDATE: I called them again (a year later) for a minor issue and they were on time, courteous, and went above an beyond.  Great company.

resp.text: Thank you so much. We appreciate your business

name: Amber Wielkens
text: This is a fantastic company. The receptionist actually apologized for not being able to get to me the same day I called - they came the next day. Brandon arrived right on time and was friendly and polite as well as very knowledgable about everything to do with garage doors. He fixed the part that was broken and told me the things that were showing signs of wear and that he could replace today without any forceful sales pitch. He also gave me a tutorial on how to oil the parts that need it and what kind to buy. All this in about half an hour. Our house is 22 years old and I will definitely be calling GDR the next time something breaks. They are stellar.

name: Gary CREASY
text: Elkins Auto Repair is the best. Certified, experienced and honest. I depend on Andy and his highly qualified staff to keep my vehicles on the road. So stop in and check them out!

name: Melissa Garner
text: Andy does excellent work. He is honest and trustworthy and reliable. He is the only person in the local area I trust to work on my GMC.

text: I was very pleased with Cassidy Glass.  Brandon was very friendly, professional, and replaced the glass in my car window without a problem.
